definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)

sentences.english: The painter bequeathed his collection of art treasures to a museum.
sentences.chinese: 這位畫家把他收藏的美術珍品遺贈給一個博物館。

sentences.english: It is no doubt a pleasant thing to have a library left you.
sentences.chinese: 有個現成的書樓遺贈給你，那無疑是一樁快事。

sentences.english: All of the contents of that house were bequeathed by Carter to the Metropolitan Museum.
sentences.chinese: 那個房子裏的所有東西都被卡特遺贈給大都會博物館。

sentences.english: Should these and similar bequests be allowed?
sentences.chinese: 這樣或類似的遺贈應當被允許嗎？

sentences.english: These books are his legacy to the college.
sentences.chinese: 這些書籍是他給學院的遺贈。

sentences.english: One proviso attaches to the legacy.
sentences.chinese: 這個遺贈附帶一項限制性條款。

sentences.english: He bequeathed to his successor a well-functioning police state.
sentences.chinese: 列寧向他的繼承人遺贈了一個運作良好的警察國家。

sentences.english: He bequeathed his fortune to her.
sentences.chinese: 他將自己的財產遺贈給她。
愛麗絲是我遺贈的禮物。

sentences.english: Mary bequeathed half of the company to her niece.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗把她公司的一半遺贈給她侄女。

sentences.english: He left his property to a hospital.
sentences.chinese: 他將他的財產遺贈給了一家醫院。

sentences.english: The picture was acquired by bequest in 1921.
sentences.chinese: 這幅畫是在1921年通過遺贈獲得的。

sentences.english: She castigated the tax on gifts and bequests as a threat to small business.
sentences.chinese: 她把對禮物和遺贈物徵稅斥之爲對小商號的一種威脅。

sentences.english: He left all his money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有的錢都遺贈給了慈善事業。

sentences.english: About half this amount comes from individual donors and bequests.
sentences.chinese: 這筆錢大約有一半來自個人捐贈及遺贈。

sentences.english: One proviso  is attached to this legacy.
sentences.chinese: 這個遺贈附帶一項限制性條款。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
